casebody.data:
Karl L. PEDERSEN, Libellant-Appellant, v. THE BULKLUBE, her engine, tackle, appurtenances, etc., Claimant-Respondent-Appellee, and Todd Shipyards Corporation, Respondent-Impleaded-Appellee. No. 179, Docket 25714. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Feb. 4, 1960. Decided Feb. 26, 1960. Herbert Lebovici, New York City (Lebovici & Safir, New York City, on the brief), for libellant-appellant. Victor S. Cichanowicz, New York City (Paul M. Jones and Cichanowicz & Callan, New York City, on the brief), for claimant-appellee. Patrick E. Gibbons, New York City (Galli, Terhune, Gibbons & Mulvehill, New York City, on the brief), for impleaded-respondent.

Before MEDINA and WATERMAN, Circuit Judges, and MADDEN, Judge, United States Court of Claims.*

PER CURIAM.

The decree is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Zavatt, 170 F.Supp. 462.
